titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 1602: Notated office book

notesStmt.note: Music: Contains Hufnagelschrift notation on 5-line staves with a red F-line.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: German manuscript containing texts and chants for the Office of the Dead (Officium pro defunctis), the funeral service for a priest, and the Divine Office. The lessons and responses in the Office of the Dead seem to be related to those used in a small group of manuscripts from the Diocese of Cologne, and the arrangement of the psalms for the Divine Office in the ferial psalter suggest that this manuscript was made for use by secular priests, such as members of a cathedral chapter, or Premonstratensian or Augustinian Canons (Les Enluminures). The volume concludes with the text for the Hours of the Virgin, whose use is unidentified but which contains a suffrage of Saint Nicholas (f. 64v), and a copy of Psalm 64 by a later hand (f. 65v).

msItem.title: Alternate lessons for the Officium pro defunctis to be read during Lent, f. 22v
Psalms and prayers in commemoration of the dead, f. 25v
Funeral service for a priest, f. 36r
Ferial psalter, Matins and Lauds, f. 45r
Ferial psalter, Prime, Terce, Sext, None, f. 59r

supportDesc.extent: 65 leaves : 202 x 145 (130-132 x 95-98) mm. bound to 205 x 155 mm

collation.p: Parchment, 65; 1⁸(-1) 2-7⁸ 8⁶ 9²(-1) 10⁴(-1); [1-65]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 20 long lines; frame-ruled in lead, sometimes with additional full horizontal lines below the second line or above the second line from the bottom. Prickings visible on many leaves.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a Gothic book script, except for a later addition in a Gothic cursive script (f. 65v).

decoDesc.decoNote: Cadel (strapwork or knotwork) initials in black with black flourishing, often including faces in profile, and red highlights in musical text; rubrics and 1- to 3-line initials in text; initials within text stroked with red.

binding.p: 18th- or early 19th-century vellum over pasteboard (Les Enluminures).

origin.p: Written in Germany, possibly in the diocese of Cologne, between 1425 and 1450 (Les Enluminures).

history.provenance: Sold by Les Enluminures (Paris and Chicago), 2011.

keywords.term: Catholic Church--Prayers and devotions--Early works to 1800
